P001752.project_name: Public Works and Capacity Building Project

keywords.cdata: Accounting,amounts owed,Auditing,audits,autonomy,cities,Civil Service,Construction Industry,debt,decision making,Economic Analysis,economic growth,Employment,feasibility studies,financial management,FISCAL YEAR,food processing,foreign exchange,garbage collection,Government regulations,government spending,housing,hygiene,income,inflation,inflation rates,information dissemination,isolation,labor force,Labor Markets,living conditions,local authorities,local governments,maturity,media,migrants,migration,payment arrears,population growth,private sector,productivity,provisions,public enterprises,public expenditure,public finance,public funds,public infrastructure,public procurement,public sector,public services,public spending,Public Works,quality of life,radio,recurrent expenditures,regulatory framework,safety,solid waste collection,Structural Adjustment,tax,tax collection,technical assistance,transparency,transport,unemployed people,unemployment,urban infrastructure,Urbanization,wages,waste,workers,working capital

project_abstract.cdata: The Public Works and Capacity Building Project consists of one major "hardware" component which, in terms of cost, represents the bulk of the project, and several "software" components including: (a) a program of essential, small-scale public works aimed at rehabilitating and maintaining urban infrastructure; (b) a package of technical and managerial assistance to be offered to contractors; (c) a training program to improve the capacity of local governments to identify subprojects, and the capacity of consulting firms to prepare feasibility studies and technical project proposals; (d) a program aimed at increasing grassroots participation in subproject identification and maintenance; (e) consulting services aimed at closely monitoring progress under the project; and (f) a procurement reform implementation component to train staff in the Direction General des Marches Publics (DGMP) and in the main technical ministries, to finance the equipment the DGMP will need to carry out its activities, and to provide consulting services for drafting standard bidding and contract documentation.
